question: I haven't been diagnose as having diabetes.  In the hospital 3 months ago my blood sugar was between 140 and 180 They gave me insulin on  4 occasions.  Other times it was 110.  Two other times over the past 3 years it has been 130-140 and they just told me it was a little high.  I have been very careful the last 3 months eating no sweets little fruit and juice and it still came up 134.  Do I need further testing?  Also I read to eat fruits and vegetables on the internet but doesn't fruit have sugar? Is bread bad? How many pieces should I limit myself to? I am also on coumadin. I am skinny and I do walk everyday. Am I worried over nothing?
title: Does a blood sugar level of 134 mean I have diabetes
